title: Quantifying Bicycle Infrastructure's Contribution to Carbon Emission Reduction
abstract: This research develops a comprehensive methodology for calculating the carbon emission reductions attributable to cycling infrastructure investments. Using life-cycle assessment combined with mode-shift modeling, we quantify both direct and indirect emission reductions across three implementation scenarios.

title: Adapting Cycling Infrastructure for Climate Resilience
abstract: This study examines how urban cycling infrastructure can be designed to address both climate mitigation and adaptation goals. We present case studies of innovative design approaches that enhance resilience to extreme weather events while continuing to provide low-carbon mobility options.

title: Impact of Cycling Infrastructure on Greenhouse Gas Emissions
abstract: This study quantifies the reduction in greenhouse gas emissions achieved through the implementation of dedicated cycling infrastructure in metropolitan areas. Using data from 12 cities, we demonstrate that each kilometer of protected bike lane leads to measurable decreases in transportation-related carbon emissions.
